channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Improving Synthetic Image Detection Towards Generalization: An Image Transformation Perspective
item.description: In this paper, we re-examine the SID problem and identify two prevalent biases in current training paradigms, i. e., weakened artifact features and overfitted artifact features.

item.title: Unified-IoU: For High-Quality Object Detection
item.description: Specifically, the loss function dynamically shifts the model's attention from low-quality prediction boxes to high-quality prediction boxes in a novel way to enhance the model's detection performance on high-precision or intensive datasets and achieve a balance in training speed.

item.title: ReCLIP++: Learn to Rectify the Bias of CLIP for Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose to explicitly model and rectify the bias existing in CLIP to facilitate the unsupervised semantic segmentation task.

item.title: Multi-Agent Continuous Control with Generative Flow Networks
item.description: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) aim to generate diverse trajectories from a distribution in which the final states of the trajectories are proportional to the reward, serving as a powerful alternative to reinforcement learning for exploratory control tasks.

item.title: Towards Cross-Domain Single Blood Cell Image Classification via Large-Scale LoRA-based Segment Anything Model
item.description: Accurate classification of blood cells plays a vital role in hematological analysis as it aids physicians in diagnosing various medical conditions.

item.title: The News Comment Gap and Algorithmic Agenda Setting in Online Forums
item.description: It is thus important to understand journalist vs reader comment preferences and how these are served by various comment ranking algorithms that represent discussions differently.

item.title: Efficient Search for Customized Activation Functions with Gradient Descent
item.description: Different activation functions work best for different deep learning models.

item.title: Deep Learning for Speaker Identification: Architectural Insights from AB-1 Corpus Analysis and Performance Evaluation
item.description: In the fields of security systems, forensic investigations, and personalized services, the importance of speech as a fundamental human input outweighs text-based interactions.

item.title: GeoFormer: Learning Point Cloud Completion with Tri-Plane Integrated Transformer
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a GeoFormer that simultaneously enhances the global geometric structure of the points and improves the local details.

item.title: BMX: Entropy-weighted Similarity and Semantic-enhanced Lexical Search
item.description: BM25, a widely-used lexical search algorithm, remains crucial in information retrieval despite the rise of pre-trained and large language models (PLMs/LLMs).

item.title: ActiveNeRF: Learning Accurate 3D Geometry by Active Pattern Projection
item.description: We design a learnable active pattern rendering pipeline which jointly learns the scene geometry and the active pattern.

item.title: Layerwise Recurrent Router for Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: The scaling of large language models (LLMs) has revolutionized their capabilities in various tasks, yet this growth must be matched with efficient computational strategies.

item.title: EE3P3D: Event-based Estimation of Periodic Phenomena Frequency using 3D Correlation
item.description: We present a novel method for measuring the frequency of periodic phenomena, e. g., rotation, flicker and vibration, by an event camera, a device asynchronously reporting brightness changes at independently operating pixels with high temporal resolution.

item.title: HDRGS: High Dynamic Range Gaussian Splatting
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Gaussian Splatting-a recent, high-quality, real-time 3D reconstruction technique-into this domain.

item.title: LongWriter: Unleashing 10,000+ Word Generation from Long Context LLMs
item.description: By incorporating this dataset into model training, we successfully scale the output length of existing models to over 10, 000 words while maintaining output quality.

item.title: Causal Agent based on Large Language Model
item.description: In the tools module, the causal agent applies causal methods to align tabular data with natural language.

item.title: Do Vision-Language Foundational models show Robust Visual Perception?
item.description: However, it is unclear if these models are robust to distribution shifts, and how their performance and generalization capabilities vary under changes in data distribution.

item.title: Integrating Saliency Ranking and Reinforcement Learning for Enhanced Object Detection
item.description: With the ever-growing variety of object detection approaches, this study explores a series of experiments that combine reinforcement learning (RL)-based visual attention methods with saliency ranking techniques to investigate transparent and sustainable solutions.

item.title: Personalized Dynamic Difficulty Adjustment -- Imitation Learning Meets Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Balancing game difficulty in video games is a key task to create interesting gaming experiences for players.

item.title: Simple but Effective Compound Geometric Operations for Temporal Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: Temporal knowledge graph completion aims to infer the missing facts in temporal knowledge graphs.

item.title: LLMs can Schedule
item.description: The job shop scheduling problem (JSSP) remains a significant hurdle in optimizing production processes.

item.title: Sumotosima: A Framework and Dataset for Classifying and Summarizing Otoscopic Images
item.description: For summarization, Sumotosima outperformed GPT-4o and LLaVA by 88. 53% and 107. 57% in ROUGE scores, respectively.

item.title: OpenResearcher: Unleashing AI for Accelerated Scientific Research
item.description: The rapid growth of scientific literature imposes significant challenges for researchers endeavoring to stay updated with the latest advancements in their fields and delve into new areas.

item.title: Large language models can consistently generate high-quality content for election disinformation operations
item.description: Advances in large language models have raised concerns about their potential use in generating compelling election disinformation at scale.

item.title: GLGait: A Global-Local Temporal Receptive Field Network for Gait Recognition in the Wild
item.description: Recently, some Convolution Neural Networks (ConvNets) based methods have been proposed to address the issue of gait recognition in the wild.

item.title: Towards Autonomous Agents: Adaptive-planning, Reasoning, and Acting in Language Models
item.description: We propose a novel in-context learning algorithm for building autonomous decision-making language agents.

item.title: BI-MDRG: Bridging Image History in Multimodal Dialogue Response Generation
item.description: In this paper, we propose BI-MDRG that bridges the response generation path such that the image history information is utilized for enhanced relevance of text responses to the image content and the consistency of objects in sequential image responses.

item.title: BooW-VTON: Boosting In-the-Wild Virtual Try-On via Mask-Free Pseudo Data Training
item.description: Existing methods always employ an accurate mask to remove the original garment in the source image, thus achieving realistic synthesized images in simple and conventional try-on scenarios based on powerful diffusion model.

item.title: DUNE: A Machine Learning Deep UNet++ based Ensemble Approach to Monthly, Seasonal and Annual Climate Forecasting
item.description: ERA5 monthly mean data is used as input for T2m over land, SST over oceans, and solar radiation at the top of the atmosphere for each month of 40 years to train the model.

item.title: MR3D-Net: Dynamic Multi-Resolution 3D Sparse Voxel Grid Fusion for LiDAR-Based Collective Perception
item.description: To address this issue, we propose MR3D-Net, a dynamic multi-resolution 3D sparse voxel grid fusion backbone architecture for LiDAR-based collective perception.

item.title: VisualAgentBench: Towards Large Multimodal Models as Visual Foundation Agents
item.description: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) have ushered in a new era in artificial intelligence, merging capabilities in both language and vision to form highly capable Visual Foundation Agents.

item.title: S-SAM: SVD-based Fine-Tuning of Segment Anything Model for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Our experiments show that S-SAM outperforms state-of-the-art methods as well as existing SAM adaptation methods while tuning a significantly less number of parameters.

item.title: A Sharpness Based Loss Function for Removing Out-of-Focus Blur
item.description: The success of modern Deep Neural Network (DNN) approaches can be attributed to the use of complex optimization criteria beyond standard losses such as mean absolute error (MAE) or mean squared error (MSE).

item.title: ControlNeXt: Powerful and Efficient Control for Image and Video Generation
item.description: In this paper, we propose ControlNeXt: a powerful and efficient method for controllable image and video generation.

item.title: FruitNeRF: A Unified Neural Radiance Field based Fruit Counting Framework
item.description: We introduce FruitNeRF, a unified novel fruit counting framework that leverages state-of-the-art view synthesis methods to count any fruit type directly in 3D.

item.title: Blind-Match: Efficient Homomorphic Encryption-Based 1:N Matching for Privacy-Preserving Biometric Identification
item.description: We present Blind-Match, a novel biometric identification system that leverages homomorphic encryption (HE) for efficient and privacy-preserving 1:N matching.

item.title: A Comprehensive Case Study on the Performance of Machine Learning Methods on the Classification of Solar Panel Electroluminescence Images
item.description: In this paper, we comprehensively compare different machine learning and deep learning methods under different performance metrics on the classification of solar cell EL images from monocrystalline and polycrystalline modules.

item.title: Understanding Byzantine Robustness in Federated Learning with A Black-box Server
item.description: Federated learning (FL) becomes vulnerable to Byzantine attacks where some of participators tend to damage the utility or discourage the convergence of the learned model via sending their malicious model updates.

item.title: Controlling Surprisal in Music Generation via Information Content Curve Matching
item.description: This enables the comparison of surprisal across different musical content even if the musical events occur in irregular time intervals.

item.title: The AI Scientist: Towards Fully Automated Open-Ended Scientific Discovery
item.description: This approach signifies the beginning of a new era in scientific discovery in machine learning: bringing the transformative benefits of AI agents to the entire research process of AI itself, and taking us closer to a world where endless affordable creativity and innovation can be unleashed on the world's most challenging problems.

item.title: GFlowNet Training by Policy Gradients
item.description: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) have been shown effective to generate combinatorial objects with desired properties.

item.title: Generalization capabilities of MeshGraphNets to unseen geometries for fluid dynamics
item.description: In our numerical tests, we show that MGNs can sometimes generalize well to various shapes by training on a dataset of one obstacle shape and testing on a dataset of another obstacle shape.

item.title: Strategy Game-Playing with Size-Constrained State Abstraction
item.description: One of the major challenges is the large search space due to a diverse set of game components.

item.title: ClickAttention: Click Region Similarity Guided Interactive Segmentation
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a click attention algorithm that expands the influence range of positive clicks based on the similarity between positively-clicked regions and the whole input.

item.title: Polyp SAM 2: Advancing Zero shot Polyp Segmentation in Colorectal Cancer Detection
item.description: Polyp segmentation plays a crucial role in the early detection and diagnosis of colorectal cancer.

item.title: Parallel transport on matrix manifolds and Exponential Action
item.description: We express parallel transport for several common matrix Lie groups with a family of pseudo-Riemannian metrics in terms of matrix exponential and exponential actions.

item.title: Depth Linear Discriminant Analysis
item.description: This study introduces a novel linear discriminant method, called Depth Linear Discriminant Analysis (D-LDA) to enhance the robustness of the original LDA.

item.title: Probabilistic Vision-Language Representation for Weakly Supervised Temporal Action Localization
item.description: To address these problems, we propose a novel framework that aligns human action knowledge and VLP knowledge in a probabilistic embedding space.

item.title: RISurConv: Rotation Invariant Surface Attention-Augmented Convolutions for 3D Point Cloud Classification and Segmentation
item.description: We achieve an overall accuracy of 96. 0% (+4. 7%) on ModelNet40, 93. 1% (+12. 8%) on ScanObjectNN, and class accuracies of 91. 5% (+3. 6%), 82. 7% (+5. 1%), and 78. 5% (+9. 2%) on the three categories of the FG3D dataset for the fine-grained classification task.

item.title: Finding Patterns in Ambiguity: Interpretable Stress Testing in the Decision~Boundary
item.description: The increasing use of deep learning across various domains highlights the importance of understanding the decision-making processes of these black-box models.
